title: Add tappable Internet Identity sign-in button to logged-out mobile screen

requirements.summary: Render a prominent, tappable sign-in button on the logged-out screen that triggers the existing Internet Identity login flow while keeping the logged-out message visible.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user is not authenticated, the page shows a prominent button that can be tapped on mobile (no text-only login state).
Tapping the button starts the Internet Identity login flow (same behavior as the existing header LoginButton).
The existing logged-out message (or equivalent) remains visible along with the button so users understand why they are being asked to sign in.

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated logged-out UI panel that keeps the existing logged-out message visible and adds a prominent primary action button. Use the existing useInternetIdentity hook to trigger the same Internet Identity login flow used by the header LoginButton (including handling the logging-in disabled state). Use the shadcn-ui Button component for a large, mobile-friendly CTA. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update AuthGate’s unauthenticated branch to render the new LoggedOutSignInPanel (instead of message-only), ensuring the screen remains centered and mobile-friendly while preserving the logged-out explanatory message alongside the new button.

requirements.summary: Ensure the logged-out screen’s primary sign-in button label explicitly reads "Sign in with Internet Identity".
acceptanceCriteria: On the logged-out screen, the primary button text is "Sign in with Internet Identity" (English).
No user-facing login text implies an invisible/automatic login; the user can always see what to tap.

file_operations.description: Set the logged-out screen CTA label to exactly "Sign in with Internet Identity" (and keep any loading-state text in clear English, e.g., "Signing in..."). Ensure the label is not reused from the header LoginButton’s generic "Sign In" text. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
